NJA.breadth_first(uid, candidates, net, threshold=2, timeout=100)[source]ïƒ

Find all nodes connected to the candidate by journeys over edges of a length <= threshold

Perform an efficient breadth-first search to find all nodes in a NJA.NJANet network connected to a candidate NJA.NJANode by taking a path consisting of only edges shorter or equal to the threshold distance.

Parameters:

  • uid (tuple) â€“ The uid of the candidate node

  • candidates (set) â€“ A set of candidate node uids (usually ones that have an edge of length <= threshold connected to them)

  • net (NJA.NJANet) â€“ The full network object

  • threshold (int) â€“ The threshold distance for each jump of the traversal. Defaults to 2.

  • timeout (int) â€“ The number of jumps to take before abandoning a search. Defaults to 100.

Returns:

The set of all node uids connected with the candidate node

Return type:

set

NJA.detect_junc(image, y: int, x: int, flatten=False) → tuple[source]ïƒ

Detect number of junctions from a pixel based on the surrounding pixels in an image.

Parameters:

  • image (numpy.array) â€“ the image to analyse

  • y (int) â€“ y coordinate of the pixel

  • x (int) â€“ x coordinate of the pixel

  • flatten â€“ Return the submatrix in a flat (1D) form rather than its usual 3x3. Defaults to False.

Returns:

(Submatrix, Num of junctions)

Return type:

tuple

NJA.trace_path(startpoint, direction, skel, print_journey=False, return_journey=False)[source]ïƒ

Trace the path between two junctions over a skeletonised image.

Traces the path from a starting point on a skeletonised image along white pixels starting in a given direction until another junction is reached.

Parameters:

  • startpoint (list) â€“ A list specifying the startpoint and its context [position, surround, juncs, None] (probably needs a refactor at some point)

  • direction (str) â€“ The direction to leave the starting pixel (captialised cardinal or ordinal directions, i.e. â€œNâ€ or â€œSWâ€)

  • skel (numpy.array) â€“ Skeletonised image to traverse

  • print_journey (bool) â€“ Whether to print the journey taken to the console. Defaults to False.

  • return_journey (bool) â€“ Whether to return the journey taken. Defaults to False.

Returns:

(endpoint, path length, [optionally, an array of the locations traversed during the trace])

Return type:

tuple
